sub_topic: The construction of the Heighway dragon curve.
message_1: What is the total length of the Heighway dragon curve after the 10th iteration, if each line segment of the initial triangular shape has a length of 1 unit?
message_2:
The Heighway dragon curve is a fractal that starts with a single line segment and iteratively adds new segments, each half the length of the previous segments. After the 10th iteration, the total length of the curve can be calculated using the formula:

Total length = initial length * (1 - (1/2)^n) / (1 - 1/2)

In this case, the initial length is 1 unit (the length of each line segment of the initial triangular shape). After 10 iterations, we can plug the values into the formula:

Total length = 1 * (1 - (1/2)^10) / (1 - 1/2)
Total length = 1 * (1 - 1/1024) / (1/2)
Total length = 1 * (1023/1024) / (1/2)
Total length = (1023/1024) * 2
Total length = 2046/1024

The total length of the Heighway dragon curve after the 10th iteration is approximately 1.998 units.
